description: The game is played on a 10x10 board with 50 dark squares. Each player starts with 20 pieces placed on the first four rows of dark squares closest to them.
The goal is to capture all the opponent's pieces or block them so they cannot make a move.
Pieces move diagonally forward one square to an unoccupied dark square.
A piece can capture an opponent's piece by jumping over it diagonally to an empty square immediately beyond. Multiple jumps are allowed in one turn.
If a player has the opportunity to capture, they must do so. If multiple captures are available, the player must make the sequence that captures the most pieces.
A piece reaching the opponent's back row is promoted to a king. Kings are marked by stacking another piece on top or turning the piece over.
Kings can move diagonally any number of squares in a straight line and capture in the same manner.
A player wins by capturing all the opponent's pieces or blocking them so they cannot make a move.
The game ends in a draw if neither player can force a win, or if the same position is repeated three times with the same player to move.
